name: docker
description: A Pulumi package for interacting with Docker in Pulumi programs
attribution: This Pulumi package is based on the [`docker` Terraform Provider](https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-docker).

caMaterial.description: PEM-encoded content of Docker host CA certificate

certMaterial.description: PEM-encoded content of Docker client certificate

certPath.description: Path to directory with Docker TLS config

keyMaterial.description: PEM-encoded content of Docker client private key

adds.description: list of linux capabilities to add.

drops.description: list of linux capabilities to drop.

containerPath.description:
The path in the container where the
device will be binded.

hostPath.description:
The path on the host where the device
is located.

permissions.description:
The cgroup permissions given to the
container to access the device.
Defaults to `rwm`.

interval.description: Time between running the check `(ms|s|m|h)`. Default: `0s`.

retries.description: Consecutive failures needed to report unhealthy. Default: `0`.

startPeriod.description: Start period for the container to initialize before counting retries towards unstable `(ms|s|m|h)`. Default: `0s`.

tests.description:
Command to run to check health. For example, to run `curl -f http://localhost/health` set the
command to be `["CMD", "curl", "-f", "http://localhost/health"]`.

timeout.description: Maximum time to allow one check to run `(ms|s|m|h)`. Default: `0s`.

ip.description: IP address this hostname should resolve to.

readOnly.description:
If true, this volume will be readonly.
Defaults to false.

source.description: The mount source (e.g., a volume name, a host path)

type.description: The mount type: valid values are `bind|volume|tmpfs`.

propagation.description: A propagation mode with the value.

mode.description: The permission mode for the tmpfs mount in an integer.

sizeBytes.description: The size for the tmpfs mount in bytes.

noCopy.description: Whether to populate volume with data from the target.

gateway.description:
*Deprecated:* Use `network_data` instead. The network gateway of the container as read from its
NetworkSettings.

ipAddress.description: *Deprecated:* Use `network_data` instead. The IP address of the container's first network it.

ipPrefixLength.description:
*Deprecated:* Use `network_data` instead. The IP prefix length of the container as read from its
NetworkSettings.

aliases.description: The network aliases of the container in the specific network.

ipv4Address.description: The IPV4 address of the container in the specific network.

ipv6Address.description: The IPV6 address of the container in the specific network.

name.description: The name of the network.

external.description: Port exposed out of the container. If not given a free random port `>= 32768` will be used.

ip.description: IP address this hostname should resolve to.

protocol.description:
Protocol that can be used over this port,
defaults to `tcp`.

content.description: Literal string value to use as the object content, which will be uploaded as UTF-8-encoded text.

executable.description:
If true, the file will be uploaded with user
executable permission.
Defaults to false.

file.description: path to a file in the container.

source.description: A filename that references a file which will be uploaded as the object content. This allows for large file uploads that do not get stored in state.

sourceHash.description: If using `source`, this will force an update if the file content has updated but the filename has not.

containerPath.description:
The path in the container where the
device will be binded.

fromContainer.description:
The container where the volume is
coming from.

hostPath.description:
The path on the host where the device
is located.

readOnly.description:
If true, this volume will be readonly.
Defaults to false.

volumeName.description:
The name of the docker volume which
should be mounted.

buildId.description: - BuildID is an optional identifier that can be passed together with the build request. The same identifier can be used to gracefully cancel the build with the cancel request

cacheFroms.description: - Images to consider as cache sources

cgroupParent.description: - Optional parent cgroup for the container

context.description: - The path to the context folder

cpuPeriod.description: - The length of a CPU period in microseconds

cpuQuota.description: - Microseconds of CPU time that the container can get in a CPU period

cpuSetCpus.description: - CPUs in which to allow execution (e.g., 0-3, 0,1)

cpuSetMems.description: - MEMs in which to allow execution (0-3, 0,1)

extraHosts.description: - A list of hostnames/IP mappings to add to the containerâ€™s /etc/hosts file. Specified in the form ["hostname:IP"]

isolation.description: - Isolation represents the isolation technology of a container. The supported values are platform specific

memorySwap.description: - Total memory (memory + swap), -1 to enable unlimited swap

networkMode.description: - Set the networking mode for the RUN instructions during build

noCache.description: - Do not use the cache when building the image

platform.description: - Set platform if server is multi-platform capable

pullParent.description: - Attempt to pull the image even if an older image exists locally

remoteContext.description: - A Git repository URI or HTTP/HTTPS context URI

remove.description: - Remove intermediate containers after a successful build (default behavior)

shmSize.description: - Size of /dev/shm in bytes. The size must be greater than 0

squash.description: - squash the new layers into a new image with a single new layer

suppressOutput.description: - Suppress the build output and print image ID on success

target.description: - Set the target build stage to build

version.description: - Version of the unerlying builder to use

name.description: type of ulimit, e.g. nofile

password.description: The password to use for authenticating to the registry. If this is blank, the `DOCKER_REGISTRY_PASS` is also be checked.

serverAddress.description: The address of the registry server

username.description: The username to use for authenticating to the registry. If this is blank, the `DOCKER_REGISTRY_USER` is also be checked.

delay.description:
Time between each the check to check docker endpoint `(ms|s|m|h)`. For example, to check if
all tasks are up when a service is created, or to check if all tasks are successfully updated on an update. Default: `7s`.

timeout.description: The timeout of the service to reach the desired state `(s|m)`. Default: `3m`.

mode.description: The mode of resolution to use for internal load balancing between tasks. `(vip|dnsrr)`. Default: `vip`.

name.description: The name of the Docker service.

protocol.description: Protocol that can be used over this port: `tcp|udp|sctp`. Default: `tcp`.

publishMode.description: Represents the mode in which the port is to be published: `ingress|host`

publishedPort.description: The port on the swarm hosts. If not set the value of `target_port` will be used.

global.description: set it to `true` to run the service in the global mode

replicated.description: , which contains atm only the amount of `replicas`

delay.description:
Delay between restart attempts `(ms|s|m|h)`
all tasks are up when a service is created, or to check if all tasks are successfully updated on an update. Default: `7s`.

maxFailureRatio.description:
The failure rate to tolerate during an update as `float`. **Important:** the `float`need to be wrapped in a `string` to avoid internal
casting and precision errors.

monitor.description: Duration after each task update to monitor for failure `(ns|us|ms|s|m|h)`

parallelism.description: The maximum number of tasks to be updated in one iteration simultaneously (0 to update all at once).

forceUpdate.description: A counter that triggers an update even if no relevant parameters have been changed. See [Docker Spec](https://github.com/docker/swarmkit/blob/master/api/specs.proto#L126).

logDriver.description: See Log Driver below for details.

networks.description: Ids of the networks in which the container will be put in.

restartPolicy.description: See Restart Policy below for details.

runtime.description: Runtime is the type of runtime specified for the task executor. See [Docker Runtime](https://github.com/moby/moby/blob/master/api/types/swarm/runtime.go).

commands.description: The command to be run in the image.

dir.description: The working directory for commands to run in.

dnsConfig.description: See DNS Config below for details.

env.description: A list of environment variables in the form VAR=value.

groups.description: A list of additional groups that the container process will run as.

hostname.description: The hostname to use for the container, as a valid RFC 1123 hostname.

image.description: The image used to create the Docker service.

isolation.description: Isolation technology of the containers running the service. (Windows only). Valid values are: `default|process|hyperv`

readOnly.description: Mount the container's root filesystem as read only.

stopGracePeriod.description: Amount of time to wait for the container to terminate before forcefully removing it `(ms|s|m|h)`.

configId.description: ConfigID represents the ID of the specific config.

configName.description: The name of the config that this references, but internally it is just provided for lookup/display purposes

fileMode.description: Represents the FileMode of the file. Defaults: `0444`

fileName.description: Represents the final filename in the filesystem. The specific target file that the config data is written within the docker container, e.g. `/root/config/config.json`

nameservers.description: The IP addresses of the name servers, for example, `8.8.8.8`

options.description: A list of internal resolver variables to be modified, for example, `debug`, `ndots:3`

searches.description: A search list for host-name lookup.

interval.description: Time between running the check `(ms|s|m|h)`. Default: `0s`.

retries.description: Consecutive failures needed to report unhealthy. Default: `0`.

startPeriod.description: Start period for the container to initialize before counting retries towards unstable `(ms|s|m|h)`. Default: `0s`.

tests.description:
Command to run to check health. For example, to run `curl -f http://localhost/health` set the
command to be `["CMD", "curl", "-f", "http://localhost/health"]`.

timeout.description: Maximum time to allow one check to run `(ms|s|m|h)`. Default: `0s`.

host.description: A list of hostname/IP mappings to add to the container's hosts file.

readOnly.description: Mount the container's root filesystem as read only.

source.description: The mount source (e.g., a volume name, a host path)

propagation.description: A propagation mode with the value.

sizeBytes.description: The size for the tmpfs mount in bytes.

noCopy.description: Whether to populate volume with data from the target.

file.description: Load credential spec from this file.

registry.description: Load credential spec from this value in the Windows registry.

fileMode.description: Represents the FileMode of the file. Defaults: `0444`

fileName.description: Represents the final filename in the filesystem. The specific target file that the secret data is written within the docker container, e.g. `/root/secret/secret.json`

secretId.description: ConfigID represents the ID of the specific secret.

secretName.description: The name of the secret that this references, but internally it is just provided for lookup/display purposes

name.description: The logging driver to use. Either `(none|json-file|syslog|journald|gelf|fluentd|awslogs|splunk|etwlogs|gcplogs)`.

options.description: The options for the logging driver, e.g.

maxReplicas.description: Maximum number of replicas for per node (default value is 0, which is unlimited)

platforms.description: Platforms stores all the platforms that the service's image can run on

prefs.description: Preferences provide a way to make the scheduler aware of factors such as topology. They are provided in order from highest to lowest precedence, e.g.: `spread=node.role.manager`

limits.description: Describes the resources which can be advertised by a node and requested by a task.

reservation.description: An object describing the resources which can be advertised by a node and requested by a task.

genericResources.description: User-defined resources can be either Integer resources (e.g, SSD=3) or String resources (e.g, GPU=UUID1)

memoryBytes.description: The amount of memory in bytes the container allocates

nanoCpus.description: CPU shares in units of 1/1e9 (or 10^-9) of the CPU. Should be at least 1000000

genericResources.description: User-defined resources can be either Integer resources (e.g, SSD=3) or String resources (e.g, GPU=UUID1)

memoryBytes.description: The amount of memory in bytes the container allocates

nanoCpus.description: CPU shares in units of 1/1e9 (or 10^-9) of the CPU. Should be at least 1000000

maxAttempts.description: Maximum attempts to restart a given container before giving up (default value is `0`, which is ignored)

window.description: The time window used to evaluate the restart policy (default value is `0`, which is unbounded) `(ms|s|m|h)`

maxFailureRatio.description:
The failure rate to tolerate during an update as `float`. **Important:** the `float`need to be wrapped in a `string` to avoid internal
casting and precision errors.

monitor.description: Duration after each task update to monitor for failure `(ns|us|ms|s|m|h)`

parallelism.description: The maximum number of tasks to be updated in one iteration simultaneously (0 to update all at once).

provider.description:
The provider type for the docker package. By default, resources use package-wide configuration
settings, however an explicit `Provider` instance may be created and passed during resource
construction to achieve fine-grained programmatic control over provider settings. See the
[documentation](https://www.pulumi.com/docs/reference/programming-model/#providers) for more information.

caMaterial.description: PEM-encoded content of Docker host CA certificate

certMaterial.description: PEM-encoded content of Docker client certificate

certPath.description: Path to directory with Docker TLS config

keyMaterial.description: PEM-encoded content of Docker client private key

attach.description: If true attach to the container after its creation and waits the end of his execution.

bridge.description: The network bridge of the container as read from its NetworkSettings.

command.description:
The command to use to start the
container. For example, to run `/usr/bin/myprogram -f baz.conf` set the
command to be `["/usr/bin/myprogram", "-f", "baz.conf"]`.

containerLogs.description: The logs of the container if its execution is done (`attach` must be disabled).

cpuSet.description: A comma-separated list or hyphen-separated range of CPUs a container can use, e.g. `0-1`.

cpuShares.description: CPU shares (relative weight) for the container.

destroyGraceSeconds.description: If defined will attempt to stop the container before destroying. Container will be destroyed after `n` seconds or on successful stop.

dnsOpts.description: Set of DNS options used by the DNS provider(s), see `resolv.conf` documentation for valid list of options.

dnsSearches.description: Set of DNS search domains that are used when bare unqualified hostnames are used inside of the container.

entrypoints.description:
The command to use as the
Entrypoint for the container. The Entrypoint allows you to configure a
container to run as an executable. For example, to run `/usr/bin/myprogram`
when starting a container, set the entrypoint to be
`["/usr/bin/myprogram"]`.

exitCode.description: The exit code of the container if its execution is done (`must_run` must be disabled).

gateway.description:
*Deprecated:* Use `network_data` instead. The network gateway of the container as read from its
NetworkSettings.
gateway.deprecationMessage: Use gateway from ip_adresses_data instead. This field exposes the data of the container's first network.

groupAdds.description: Add additional groups to run as.

image.description:
The ID of the image to back this container.
The easiest way to get this value is to use the `docker.RemoteImage` resource
as is shown in the example above.

init.description: Configured whether an init process should be injected for this container. If unset this will default to the `dockerd` defaults.

ipAddress.description: *Deprecated:* Use `network_data` instead. The IP address of the container's first network it.
ipAddress.deprecationMessage: Use ip_adresses_data instead. This field exposes the data of the container's first network.

ipPrefixLength.description:
*Deprecated:* Use `network_data` instead. The IP prefix length of the container as read from its
NetworkSettings.
ipPrefixLength.deprecationMessage: Use ip_prefix_length from ip_adresses_data instead. This field exposes the data of the container's first network.

ipcMode.description: IPC sharing mode for the container. Possible values are: `none`, `private`, `shareable`, `container:<name|id>` or `host`.

links.description:
Set of links for link based
connectivity between containers that are running on the same host.
links.deprecationMessage: The --link flag is a legacy feature of Docker. It may eventually be removed.

logDriver.description:
The logging driver to use for the container.
Defaults to "json-file".

logOpts.description:
Key/value pairs to use as options for
the logging driver.

logs.description: Save the container logs (`attach` must be enabled).

maxRetryCount.description:
The maximum amount of times to an attempt
a restart when `restart` is set to "on-failure"

memory.description: The memory limit for the container in MBs.

networkAliases.description: Network aliases of the container for user-defined networks only. *Deprecated:* use `networks_advanced` instead.
networkAliases.deprecationMessage: Use networks_advanced instead. Will be removed in v2.0.0

networkDatas.description:
(Map of a block) The IP addresses of the container on each
network. Key are the network names, values are the IP addresses.

networks.description:
Id of the networks in which the
container is. *Deprecated:* use `networks_advanced` instead.
networks.deprecationMessage: Use networks_advanced instead. Will be removed in v2.0.0

networksAdvanced.description: See Networks Advanced below for details. If this block has priority to the deprecated `network_alias` and `network` properties.

pidMode.description: The PID (Process) Namespace mode for the container. Either `container:<name|id>` or `host`.

publishAllPorts.description: Publish all ports of the container.

readOnly.description:
If true, this volume will be readonly.
Defaults to false.

restart.description:
The restart policy for the container. Must be
one of "no", "on-failure", "always", "unless-stopped".

securityOpts.description: Set of string values to customize labels for MLS systems, such as SELinux. See https://docs.docker.com/engine/reference/run/#security-configuration.

start.description:
If true, then the Docker container will be
started after creation. If false, then the container is only created.

stdinOpen.description: if true, keep STDIN open even if not attached (docker run -i)

sysctls.description: A map of kernel parameters (sysctls) to set in the container.

tmpfs.description: A map of container directories which should be replaced by `tmpfs mounts`, and their corresponding mount options.

tty.description: if true, allocate a pseudo-tty (docker run -t)

uploads.description: See File Upload below for details.

user.description:
User used for run the first process. Format is
`user` or `user:group` which user and group can be passed literraly or
by name.

usernsMode.description: Sets the usernamespace mode for the container when usernamespace remapping option is enabled.

workingDir.description: The working directory for commands to run in

attach.description: If true attach to the container after its creation and waits the end of his execution.

command.description:
The command to use to start the
container. For example, to run `/usr/bin/myprogram -f baz.conf` set the
command to be `["/usr/bin/myprogram", "-f", "baz.conf"]`.

cpuSet.description: A comma-separated list or hyphen-separated range of CPUs a container can use, e.g. `0-1`.

cpuShares.description: CPU shares (relative weight) for the container.

destroyGraceSeconds.description: If defined will attempt to stop the container before destroying. Container will be destroyed after `n` seconds or on successful stop.

dnsOpts.description: Set of DNS options used by the DNS provider(s), see `resolv.conf` documentation for valid list of options.

dnsSearches.description: Set of DNS search domains that are used when bare unqualified hostnames are used inside of the container.

Entrypoint for the container. The Entrypoint allows you to configure a
container to run as an executable. For example, to run `/usr/bin/myprogram`
when starting a container, set the entrypoint to be
`["/usr/bin/myprogram"]`.

attachable.description:
Enable manual container attachment to the network.
Defaults to `false`.

checkDuplicate.description:
Requests daemon to check for networks
with same name.

driver.description:
Name of the network driver to use. Defaults to
`bridge` driver.

ingress.description:
Create swarm routing-mesh network.
Defaults to `false`.

internal.description:
Restrict external access to the network.
Defaults to `false`.

ipamConfigs.description:
See IPAM config below for
details.

ipamDriver.description:
Driver used by the custom IP scheme of the
network.

name.description: The name of the Docker network.

options.description:
Network specific options to be used by
the drivers.

attachable.description:
Enable manual container attachment to the network.
Defaults to `false`.

checkDuplicate.description:
Requests daemon to check for networks
with same name.

alias.description: The alias of the Docker plugin. If the tag is omitted, `:latest` is complemented to the attribute value.

enableTimeout.description: HTTP client timeout to enable the plugin.

enabled.description: If true, the plugin is enabled. The default value is `true`.

forceDestroy.description: If true, the plugin is removed forcibly when the plugin is removed.

forceDisable.description: If true, then the plugin is disabled forcibly when the plugin is disabled.

grantAllPermissions.description: If true, grant all permissions necessary to run the plugin. This attribute conflicts with `grant_permissions`.

grantPermissions.description: grant permissions necessary to run the plugin. This attribute conflicts with `grant_all_permissions`. See grant_permissions below for details.

keepRemotely.description:
If true, then the Docker image won't be
deleted on destroy operation. If this is false, it will delete the image from
the docker registry on destroy operation.

the docker registry on destroy operation.

keepLocally.description:
If true, then the Docker image won't be
deleted on destroy operation. If this is false, it will delete the image from
the docker local storage on destroy operation.

name.description: The name of the Docker image, including any tags or SHA256 repo digests.

pullTriggers.description:
List of values which cause an
image pull when changed. This is used to store the image digest from the
registry when using the `docker.RegistryImage` [data source](https://www.terraform.io/docs/providers/docker/d/registry_image.html)
to trigger an image update.

docker:index/secret:Secret.description:
## Import

Docker secret cannot be imported as the secret data, once set, is never exposed again.

data.description: The base64 encoded data of the secret.

name.description: The name of the Docker secret.

data.description: The base64 encoded data of the secret.

name.description: The name of the Docker secret.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering Secret resources.

data.description: The base64 encoded data of the secret.

name.description: The name of the Docker secret.

docker:index/service:Service.description:
## Import

Docker service can be imported using the long id, e.g. for a service with the short id `55ba873dd`

```sh
 $ pulumi import docker:index/service:Service foo $(docker service inspect -f {{.ID}} 55b)
```

convergeConfig.description: See Converge Config below for details.

name.description: The name of the Docker service.

convergeConfig.description: See Converge Config below for details.

name.description: The name of the Docker service.

docker:index/serviceConfig:ServiceConfig.description:
## Import

Docker config can be imported using the long id, e.g. for a config with the short id `p73jelnrme5f`

```sh
 $ pulumi import docker:index/serviceConfig:ServiceConfig foo $(docker config inspect -f {{.ID}} p73)
```

data.description: The base64 encoded data of the config.

name.description: The name of the Docker config.

data.description: The base64 encoded data of the config.

name.description: The name of the Docker config.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering ServiceConfig resources.

data.description: The base64 encoded data of the config.

name.description: The name of the Docker config.

The name of the Docker volume (generated if not
provided).

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getNetwork.

id.description: The id of the Docker network.

name.description: The name of the Docker network.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getNetwork.

driver.description:
(Optional, string) The driver of the Docker network. 
Possible values are `bridge`, `host`, `overlay`, `macvlan`.
See [docker docs][networkdocs] for more details.

options.description:
(Optional, map) Only available with bridge networks. See
[docker docs][bridgeoptionsdocs] for more details.
* `internal` (Optional, bool) Boolean flag for whether the network is internal.
* `ipam_config` (Optional, map) See IPAM below for details.
* `scope` (Optional, string) Scope of the network. One of `swarm`, `global`, or `local`.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getPlugin.

alias.description: The alias of the Docker plugin.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getPlugin.

grantAllPermissions.description: (Optional, boolean) If true, grant all permissions necessary to run the plugin.

pluginReference.description: (Optional, string, Forces new resource) The plugin reference.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getRegistryImage.

name.description: The name of the Docker image, including any tags. e.g. `alpine:latest`

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getRegistryImage.

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.
